Hi @eayan , 
This is not possible yet, but I think it is planned in #15, right?
I close this one as duplicate of #15 , please reopen and explain if you think it's not the case. Thanks.
Hi @edumoreira1506 , that's awesome! I'll take a quick look to understand how this works.
Sure! If you have some doubt, I am here :)
Hi @edumoreira1506 , I only have one question/concern: the dependencies added only for tests, shouldn't they be in `devDependencies`  in `package.json` ? Thanks.
@stellasia Sure! I forgot this, but now it's fixed!
@edumoreira1506 awesome! Thank you very much for putting this in place! I probably need to define more precise test cases now, but it's already a relief to have those ones!

Let's close this one since @edumoreira1506 kindly started implementing tests in https://github.com/stellasia/neomap/pull/24 and was followed by https://github.com/stellasia/neomap/pull/25. Better tests are still needed but they will depend on further implementation improvements (creation of a "service" to manage all graph queries?).

Hi Mickael!

Thanks a lot for the suggestions!

There is already a hard-coded limit of 5000, which is maybe too high. I plan to make customizable in (https://github.com/stellasia/neomap/issues/9). It will also become more visible with https://github.com/stellasia/neomap/issues/28, which is definitely a must-have!
Done.
Both "show query" and "switch from simple to advanced layer" are done in 0.3.0
The maximum number of nodes to fetch is now customizable in 0.3.0 (default is 2000)

Perhaps it got accidentally copied to Advanced Layer? (Should be probably "custom" layer or query layer) Now there is a tooltip -> name field there which doesn't make sense as you write a manual query.
One still has to use "tooltip" in the query, like documented so that "name" there has no effect?
Oh I didn't realize that you can do multiple labels, which is really cool. So your first part of the query should probably stay the same.
Right, tooltip comes from the query in Advanced layer type, the input text should not be displayed.
Indeed....

I actually tried that during the hachathon, but never managed to make it work. 

One package was published here:
https://github.com/stellasia/neomap/packages/28018?version=0.2.0

but then I cannot get the correct link for Neo4j Desktop. Any idea?
Removed in 0.3.1
Done in 0.3.1, thanks!
Done in 0.3.1
Done in 0.3.1 (duplicate of #35 )

So I checked on panama pappers, it seems that at least in heatmap mode it can easily render 200k nodes in 3 seconds which is really cool!

Marker mode is more resource intensive.

Perhaps similar to flight paths on a map?

there are several "curve" plugins here: https://leafletjs.com/plugins.html
